headline: Southern (SO) Margin Miss Challenges Bullish Narratives on Profit Quality and Valuation
summary: Southern (SO) posted a net profit margin of 15.4%, down from last year’s 17.9%, and growth in earnings over the past five years averaged 10.6% annually. Looking ahead, the company expects earnings to climb at an 8.7% annual rate and revenue to increase by 5% per year. Both figures trail broader US market forecasts. With its Price-To-Earnings Ratio of 23.2x sitting below its peer average but above the industry, investors are left weighing slowing growth and margin compression against...
